pingball.physics

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.physics.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
    A Ball is a computerized model of a physical, impenetrable ball that will bounce around in a pingball game (a computerized version of pinball). The ball moves around freely, experiencing both gravity and friction on the Board that it lies in and bounces around hitting different Gadgets.
    Author:
    enguyen, nconsul, spefley

      Ball(java.lang.String name, double velX, double velY, double x, double y, double g, double mu, double mu2)
      Creates a ball with a given initial velocity in the x and y directions at the desired starting point (x, y) with a default diameter of 0.5L.

      Creates a ball with a given initial velocity in the x and y directions at the desired starting point (x, y) with the desired radius in units of L

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(java.lang.String name,
    double velX,
    double velY,
    double x,
    double y,
    double g,
    double mu,
    double mu2)
        Creates a ball with a given initial velocity in the x and y directions at the desired starting point (x, y) with a default diameter of 0.5L.
        Parameters:
        velX - represents the initial velocity in the x-direction (double)
        velY - represents the initial velocity in the y-direction (double)
        x - represents the initial position in the x-direction (double)
        y - represents the initial position in the y-direction (double)
        g - represents the gravitational acceleration that this ball will experience in units of L/sec^2 (double)
        mu - represents the constant for friction that this ball will experience in units of 1/sec
        mu2 - represents the constant for friction that this ball will experience in units of 1/L

      • Ball

        public Ball(java.lang.String name,
    double velX,
    double velY,
    double x,
    double y,
    double d,
    double g,
    double mu,
    double mu2)
        Creates a ball with a given initial velocity in the x and y directions at the desired starting point (x, y) with the desired radius in units of L
        Parameters:
        velX - represents the initial velocity in the x-direction (double)
        velY - represents the initial velocity in the y-direction (double)
        x - represents the initial position in the x-direction (double)
        y - represents the initial position in the y-direction (double)
        d - represents the diameter of this ball in units of L (double)
        g - represents the gravitational acceleration that this ball will experience in units of L/sec^2 (double)
        mu - represents the constant for friction that this ball will experience in units of 1/sec
        mu2 - represents the constant for friction that this ball will experience in units of 1/L

      • putInDisplay

        public void putInDisplay(char[][] board,
                int hOffset,
                int vOffset)
        Puts the ball into the provided board in text format. The given board may have buffers on the outer edges such that the true origin of the board maybe offset towards the inside
        Parameters:
        board - the board to have text put in
        hOffset - the horizontal offset of the board's origin
        vOffset - the vertical offset of the board's origin
